trans-unit.source: Connecting Azure Cloud Services Roles to a custom AD Domain Controller hosted in Azure
trans-unit.target: Connecting Azure Cloud Services Roles to a custom AD Domain Controller hosted in Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to connect your web/worker roles to a custom AD Domain using Powershell and AD Domain Extension
trans-unit.target: Learn how to connect your web/worker roles to a custom AD Domain using Powershell and AD Domain Extension

trans-unit.source: Connecting Azure Cloud Services Roles to a custom AD Domain Controller hosted in Azure
trans-unit.target: Connecting Azure Cloud Services Roles to a custom AD Domain Controller hosted in Azure

trans-unit.source: Stepwise guide to connect your Azure Web/Worker roles to a custom domain controller hosted on Azure
trans-unit.target: Stepwise guide to connect your Azure Web/Worker roles to a custom domain controller hosted on Azure

trans-unit.source: We will first set up a Virtual Network (VNET) in Azure.
trans-unit.target: We will first set up a Virtual Network (VNET) in Azure.

trans-unit.source: We will then add an Active Directory Domain Controller (hosted on an Azure Virtual Machine) to the VNET.
trans-unit.target: We will then add an Active Directory Domain Controller (hosted on an Azure Virtual Machine) to the VNET.

trans-unit.source: Next, we will add existing cloud service roles to the pre-created VNET and subsequently connect them to the Domain Controller.
trans-unit.target: Next, we will add existing cloud service roles to the pre-created VNET and subsequently connect them to the Domain Controller.

trans-unit.source: Before we get started, couple of things to keep in mind:
trans-unit.target: Before we get started, couple of things to keep in mind:

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses Powershell, so please make sure you have Azure Powershell installed and ready to go.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses Powershell, so please make sure you have Azure Powershell installed and ready to go.

trans-unit.source: To get help with setting up Azure Powershell, see [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](../install-configure-powershell.md).
trans-unit.target: To get help with setting up Azure Powershell, see [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](../install-configure-powershell.md).

trans-unit.source: Your AD Domain Controller and Web/Worker Role instances need to be in the VNET.
trans-unit.target: Your AD Domain Controller and Web/Worker Role instances need to be in the VNET.

trans-unit.source: Follow this step-by-step guide and if you run into any issues, leave us a comment below.
trans-unit.target: Follow this step-by-step guide and if you run into any issues, leave us a comment below.

trans-unit.source: Someone will get back to you (yes, we do read comments).
trans-unit.target: Someone will get back to you (yes, we do read comments).

trans-unit.source: Create a Virtual Network
trans-unit.target: Create a Virtual Network

trans-unit.source: You can create a Virtual Network in Azure using the Azure Portal or Powershell.
trans-unit.target: You can create a Virtual Network in Azure using the Azure Portal or Powershell.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, we will use Powershell.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, we will use Powershell.

trans-unit.source: To create a Virtual Network using the Azure Portal, see [Create Virtual Network](../create-virtual-network.md).
trans-unit.target: To create a Virtual Network using the Azure Portal, see [Create Virtual Network](../create-virtual-network.md).

trans-unit.source: Create a Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Create a Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: Once you have completed setting up the Virtual Network, you will need to create an AD Domain Controller.
trans-unit.target: Once you have completed setting up the Virtual Network, you will need to create an AD Domain Controller.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, we will be setting up an AD Domain Controller on an Azure Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, we will be setting up an AD Domain Controller on an Azure Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: To do this, create a virtual machine through Powershell using the commands below.
trans-unit.target: To do this, create a virtual machine through Powershell using the commands below.

trans-unit.source: Promote your Virtual Machine to a Domain Controller
trans-unit.target: Promote your Virtual Machine to a Domain Controller

trans-unit.source: To configure the Virtual Machine as an AD Domain Controller, you will need to log in to the VM and configure it.
trans-unit.target: To configure the Virtual Machine as an AD Domain Controller, you will need to log in to the VM and configure it.

trans-unit.source: To log in to the VM, you can get the RDP file through Powershell, use the commands below.
trans-unit.target: To log in to the VM, you can get the RDP file through Powershell, use the commands below.

trans-unit.source: Once you are logged into the VM, setup your Virtual Machine as an AD Domain Controller by following the step-by-step guide on [How to setup your customer AD Domain Controller](http://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/12370.windows-server-2012-set-up-your-first-domain-controller-step-by-step.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Once you are logged into the VM, setup your Virtual Machine as an AD Domain Controller by following the step-by-step guide on [How to setup your customer AD Domain Controller](http://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/12370.windows-server-2012-set-up-your-first-domain-controller-step-by-step.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Add your Cloud Service deployment to the Virtual Network
trans-unit.target: Add your Cloud Service deployment to the Virtual Network

trans-unit.source: Next, you need to add your cloud service deployment to the VNET you just created.
trans-unit.target: Next, you need to add your cloud service deployment to the VNET you just created.

trans-unit.source: To do this, modify your cloud service cscfg by adding the relevant sections to your cscfg using Visual Studio or the editor of your choice.
trans-unit.target: To do this, modify your cloud service cscfg by adding the relevant sections to your cscfg using Visual Studio or the editor of your choice.

trans-unit.source: Next build your cloud services project and deploy it to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Next build your cloud services project and deploy it to Azure.

trans-unit.source: To get help with deploying your cloud services package to Azure, see [How to Create and Deploy a Cloud Service](cloud-services-how-to-create-deploy.md#deploy)
trans-unit.target: To get help with deploying your cloud services package to Azure, see [How to Create and Deploy a Cloud Service](cloud-services-how-to-create-deploy.md#deploy)

trans-unit.source: Connect your web/worker role(s) to the custom domain using the AD Domain Extension
trans-unit.target: Connect your web/worker role(s) to the custom domain using the AD Domain Extension

trans-unit.source: Once your cloud service project is deployed on Azure, connect your role instances to the custom AD domain using the AD Domain Extension.
trans-unit.target: Once your cloud service project is deployed on Azure, connect your role instances to the custom AD domain using the AD Domain Extension.

trans-unit.source: To add the AD Domain Extension to your existing cloud services deployment and join the custom domain, execute the following commands in Powershell:
trans-unit.target: To add the AD Domain Extension to your existing cloud services deployment and join the custom domain, execute the following commands in Powershell:

trans-unit.source: And that’s it.
trans-unit.target: And that’s it.

trans-unit.source: You cloud services should now be joined to your custom domain controller.
trans-unit.target: You cloud services should now be joined to your custom domain controller.

trans-unit.source: If you would like to learn more about the different options available for how to configure AD Domain Extension, use the PS help as shown below.
trans-unit.target: If you would like to learn more about the different options available for how to configure AD Domain Extension, use the PS help as shown below.

trans-unit.source: We would also like your feedback on if it would be useful for you to have an extension that promotes a Virtual Machine to a Domain Controller.
trans-unit.target: We would also like your feedback on if it would be useful for you to have an extension that promotes a Virtual Machine to a Domain Controller.

trans-unit.source: So if you think it would be, please let us know in the comments section.
trans-unit.target: So if you think it would be, please let us know in the comments section.

trans-unit.source: Hope you found this helpful!
trans-unit.target: Hope you found this helpful!

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
